title: @Jaredan, is there consensus now whether Jhin has a Robotic Arm or an Armored Arm?
body:
During the AMA, writers said he had all his limbs intact, but some artists answered that he was a cyborg; even the splash suggests his arm is robotic. 

Have this been settled now; is there a consensus if he's a cyborg or not in canon?

replies.body:
Jhin is not a robot.  It was changed early in the process to armor.  We had some communication errors on this champ because of absences and experiments with the production process.  
(PS Kindlejack was not this team so im not exactly sure why he's commenting)
Guess he thought he had the right answer and sought to tell what I thought was correct information. Happens to the best of folks.
Well, you can be not a robot but have a prosthesis because you lost an arm.

> [{quoted}](name=Photos of Ghosts,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=PAh2s6eQ,comment-id=00010002,timestamp=2016-03-01T17:12:22.010+0000)
>
> Well, you can be not a robot but have a prosthesis because you lost an arm.

And an eye.

And two lower legs.
Thanks for clarifying! Too bad the splash slightly confuses the matter; I hope someone finds an opportunity to make a few edits on the splash in the future!
His arm is armored. He has all his limbs.

"His arm isn't robotic. He's got a black body sleeve on. Inna creepy gimp way). The gold armor on his sleeve is to protect him from the weapons magical recoil." -Jaredan

"Check the in game model. There must have been some disconnect at some point. (or [the splash artist] were ref old [concept art].) he is not a robot." -WaaaarghBobo

"I guess it was rewritten just before launch?" -Kindlejack

Yes, I'm sure.
i see. so my dreams of playing as a Sniper with robotic feet and arms is a lie.
